{"step_by_step_thinking": "Penicillin allergy is a type of hypersensitivity reaction. In this case, penicillin acts as a hapten. A hapten is a small molecule that can elicit an immune response only when attached to a large carrier such as a protein; the carrier may be one that also does not elicit an immune response by itself. In this case, penicillin binds to a protein within the body, and this complex can then elicit an immune response leading to an allergic reaction.", "answer_choice": "A"}
